triples.name: Convention (norm)
triples.relevance: The paper demonstrates how LLM populations spontaneously establish social conventions as a form of collective agreement and coordinated behavior.

triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: LLMs are the primary artificial agents studied in the paper to investigate emergent social behavior and convention formation.

triples.name: Bias
triples.relevance: The paper proposes the emergence of collective bias in LLM populations despite individual agents showing no bias, revealing a novel phenomenon.

triples.name: Collective behavior
triples.relevance: The paper investigates how collective biases emerge from interactions in decentralized LLM populations, exemplifying spontaneous collective behavior.

triples.name: AI alignment
triples.relevance: The paper addresses implications for AI alignment with human values and societal goals, a key concern in AI safety research.

triples.name: Natural language
triples.relevance: LLM agents communicate through natural language to coordinate and develop social conventions in the experimental setup.

triples.name: Artificial intelligence
triples.relevance: The paper studies autonomous AI agents and their capacity to develop social structures without explicit programming.

triples.name: Coordination game
triples.relevance: The emergent social conventions studied can be understood as equilibrium solutions to coordination problems among LLM agents.
